Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: not sure how ca is doing it for that system. But all we have done is change the pubkeys so that you can run your own ntoary nodes  to notarise to KMD. Without breakign dpow inside the komodo daemon for KMD.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: sorryt if that sounds confusing... It simpy allows anyone to notarise anything to KMD without needing the KMD ntoary nodes directly... Its uses them indirectly by notarisign to KMD, they get the benefit of the BTC secuity KMD notarty nodes provide KMD.

Content: For the main chain I had to get the notary pay working as fast as possible to launch it.. I think a contract will be better for 0BR chains... but that said I dont really see how exactly it can even work.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Does that fork it?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: hmm .. I think its pretty easy to understaand if I explain it properly.. the code is extremly well commented for -ac_notarypay= chains... it was very hajrd to brain storm out the process... and it changed a few times as I wrote it.. Ran into a few dead ends along the way. I think it still has some possible problem, but the chain appears to work.. even with 300 block happenign in 10 mins.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I think I need a way to flag a notarisation thats invalid... but some nodes might see a notarisation as invalid when other see it as valid... so doing hta might not work.. Once the notarisation is included by just 1 miner, then that chain is the chain everyone must follow.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Which is kind of how it already works...

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: What effecttivly is happening, is that we are making the checkpoint transaction itself a checkpoint, the block its included in must be accpeted by all nodes.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: so evey node must accept a notarisation as valid, if the miner who mined that transaction saw it as  valid.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Doing it with a CC, basically notary nodes would be able to send txs with min sigs to the contract.. .na then have coins avalibe to withdraw... too much trust in them not to cheat for my liking. This wasy they just cant cheat.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Pushed fix to start.sh. If a chain is just stalled it will now allow auto starting of iguana. The idea was that the start.sh would fail, and you would see the reson it was failed. then start it manually... But when it was all fully automated ages ago, it got a bit compicated.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Not sure what I am supposed to be working on atm. So going to play with chain params for 0BR chains and try to do some econimics of how expensive they will be....

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I think its possible to extend a chains length as long as more LABS is burnt far enough in advance for notaries to increase the chains maximum height.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: This avoids tricky CC contract complications in the coin emission... Just have notaries verify the LABS was burnt to cover the notarisation cost.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Its even possible to make it so that the chain is free and notarisation cost is enough to cover the notarisations fees, as long as everyone agrees on this... So if a chain ends up being very popular and notaries collectivly decide to host it and notarise it, they can just accept to be paid 10,000 sat per notarisation, I think we can height activate this for each chain in the code wihtou much issue as I dont see it happening very often. In reality notarisation dont always happen, so they would still get paid some small amount.But its insignificant in the scheme of things. There is still a KMD notarisation cost to be considered,. but if we can self fund this with a KMD notary node OR by selling LABS paid to notaries on the main chain then everything is fine.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: This seems to be the last hurdle to overcome... Defining coin emission so that its a fair as possible while haveing enough built in buying power to make being a ntoary profitable.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: The case of adding or removing notaries can be decided by a stake holder VOTE and airdrop to a vot chain like KMD does.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: So if there are a lot of stake holder that want to be a notary node they can simply have a VOTE (nothing stopping anyone airdropping a vote chain, and it can be easily verified by others) to increase the number of notary ndoes. Like wise if a notary node is being a bad actor/gone AWOL a VOTE can be taken to remove that notary.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: If a notary decides to step down, that can also be taken into account, I dont think selling ndoes should be allowed, there should be liek a byelection to vote a new node to his/her place.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Just some tahughts for you guys to think about. Likey we can change thigns as we go along as long as a vote is held for changes. Likely an easy way to handle votes should be created as a project of the LABS project along the line, or maybe if Verus solution is finishd by then we just use theirs lol.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content:
`komodod -ac_name=LABS01 -ac_supply=1000 -ac_reward=1 -ac_end=1 -ac_algo=verushash11 -ac_staked=20 -ac_notarypay=36000`
If my math is correct this chain would cost ~1200 LABS to last an entire year, with 1000 of that being held by the chains creator to stake on the chain, they can recover this for something else at any time. The other 200 is paid to notary nodes for ntoarisation, mayeb 200 LABS a year is too low, but I think its the minimum viable amount., with 20 notaries.

The staked value only needs to be very small, likely the 1000 LABS to start the chain will not even need to remain on the chain long term, its up to the chain creator to do whatever they like here. Once the chain has no stakers it will simply stop moving and can be removed from the cluster, as per my proposal for handling this. Also we have a way to add a chain to a banned list, if a VOTE decides that a chain should be dropped OR  bug effecting coin emission is found. Notaries can just stop notarising a chain if they see fit to do so I guess as well.. 
If notaries stop notarising then the chain is effectivly no longer fungible... There is not really any way to enforce this this, it will be up to each notary. Hopefully they all keep notarising everything if they can. A vote can be had to remove or add notaries at basically any time (maybe min 2 months since last vote, as to not happen too often and cause problems and waste ppls time)

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: We can still use a "top notarisations" metric to determine each 2 months the bottom notaries, and there can be a vote of all stake holders on weather someone needs to be removed and if we need to increase the number of notary nodes.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I thaught about genies idea, and while tis possible to get a count of who is in recvmask the most, its not releavent, as the total number of notarisations will be exactly correlated with that.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content:
I think a test of the main chain must be done, to amke sure that it works, if this works and we have a set of defined rules in place we can launch quite soon.
We also need to test ac_notarypay does not break MoMoM so with the main chain test, and he current LABSTPAY chain we need to run migrate loops for a few days while logging fails. It doenst need to be full blocks or anything, just 1 export in each block, like earlier tests. I think I can probably set up a VM to do this on my own, but more ppl testing provides better data.

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: if votes are more than yearly, it's be cool to have a pledge system. Users designate their vote stake to a notary (or group of notaries), changeable after locktime expiry of 2 months or so. That way no crypto-citizen misses out on sufferage through absence, and voting isnt a constant obligation. set and forget until a notary pisses you off or makes an impression - then reallocate.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Its more there just incase a notary with very high counts is doing something everyone does not like... And we can always increaes the amount of nodes... but notaries are not going to like that because it means they get paid less... So it ahs to be up to all stake holders.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: a valid vote chain would be something like > 30% of stake weight voted and an outcome was reached....

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: if not its just ignored...

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I dont think a set election is viable, every 2 months

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: they should only happen if something needs to change.. Trust worthy notaris are very important to this type of blochchain, chanign them often leads to issues, but adding more seems fine if the demabnd is there for people to want to be one.
